interactions.resultText: You concentrate on the Ring's magic, feeling its influence grow stronger. The world becomes even more distant and muted, but your invisibility becomes more perfect, allowing you to move with complete stealth through the chaos.

Through your enhanced perception while wearing the Ring, you notice remnants of the old prison cells that once held you captive. The memory of your escape fills you with confidence in your abilities as a burglar.

Moving unseen among the wounded, you quietly leave portions of elven lembas bread beside those most in need. They look around in wonder at this mysterious aid, not knowing their invisible benefactor watches over them.

You pause to examine your own heart, wondering what drives you to risk everything for companions who may never know of your invisible aid. The answer comes from deep within: true heroism needs no recognition or reward.

You decide to use your invisibility to systematically aid the wounded and dying across the battlefield, becoming an unseen angel of mercy in this place of violence and death. Your compassion guides your actions.

From your invisible vantage point, you see the true horror and occasional beauty of war. Heroes fall beside cowards, enemies show mercy, and allies betray trust. The Ring shows you truth stripped of illusion.

eagle_alliance.title: Alliance of the Skies
eagle_alliance.content: Mounted upon the broad back of the Lord of the Eagles, you soar high above the battlefield as the wind whips through your hair. From this elevated position, the scope of the conflict becomes clear - goblin armies stream from multiple mountain passes while the combined forces of elves, men, and dwarves struggle to hold their ground below. The Lord of the Eagles awaits your counsel on how best to deploy his aerial forces. You can see key positions where the eagles might strike decisively, or you could coordinate with the ground forces for a more strategic approach. The fate of the battle may rest on the wisdom of your choice - do you strike boldly from above, or do you serve as the vital link between earth and sky in this desperate hour?

interactions.resultText: You point toward the goblin commanders massed on the northern ridge. 'Strike there!' you shout over the wind. 'Cut off their head and the body will fall!' The Lord of the Eagles cries out in agreement and wheels toward the target, his kin following in formation.

You signal to the eagle lord to maintain communication with the armies below. 'We must work together!' you call out. 'Let the eagles support the ground assault rather than fight alone!' This coordinated approach may prove more effective.

interactions.buttonText: Discuss strategy with the eagle lord
interactions.resultText: The mighty eagle considers your words carefully. 'You speak with wisdom beyond your size, small one. The choice of how to strike is yours to make - we eagles are bound by ancient oaths to aid those who show courage and honor.'

You raise Gandalf's staff high, and its crystal tip blazes with white light visible across the battlefield. The sight of the wizard's token rallies both eagles and ground forces, coordinating their efforts in the coming assault.

interactions.buttonText: Return to The Lonely Mountain Interior
interactions.resultText: You make your way back to the lonely mountain interior.

aerial_combat.title: Battle in the Clouds
aerial_combat.content:
You cling desperately to the great eagle's back as it wheels through the sky above the battlefield. The Lord of the Eagles banks sharply to avoid a volley of arrows from goblin archers below, his massive wings cutting through the air with thunderous beats. The wind tears at your clothes and hair as you witness the battle from this dizzying height - armies clash like ants far below, while overhead eagles engage in aerial combat with fell beasts and their riders.

The Lord of the Eagles screeches a war cry that echoes across the valley. 'Hold fast, Master Burglar!' he calls back to you. 'The tide of battle turns with our arrival!' A goblin warg-rider leaps from a nearby crag, trying to bring down your mount, but the eagle's keen eyes spot the threat. You feel the familiar weight of Sting at your side and notice your rope secured to your pack - tools that might prove useful in this aerial melee.

interactions.buttonText: Draw Sting to defend the eagle
interactions.resultText: You draw Sting from its sheath, its blue glow cutting through the wind. The blade hums with power as you slash at a goblin trying to climb onto the eagle's wing, sending the creature tumbling into the void below.

From this aerial vantage point, you can see the full scope of the Battle of Five Armies. Dwarves, men, and elves fight desperately against waves of goblins and wargs. You spot Thorin's golden armor gleaming as he leads a charge toward Ravenhill.

interactions.buttonText: Speak with the Lord of the Eagles
interactions.resultText: The great eagle turns his fierce golden eye toward you. 'The Goblins have grown bold, small one! But we shall remind them why eagles rule the skies. Point us toward where you are most needed!'

You quickly tie the elven rope around the eagle's harness and your waist. The secure connection allows you to move more freely while still staying mounted during the eagle's dramatic aerial maneuvers.

interactions.buttonText: Direct the eagle to dive-bomb goblin forces
interactions.resultText: You point toward a concentration of goblin reinforcements climbing the mountainside. 'There!' you shout. The Lord of the Eagles folds his wings and plunges downward in a controlled dive that makes your stomach lurch.
You see another eagle struggling with two goblin riders. 'Help that eagle!' you call out. Your mount immediately changes course, prioritizing the safety of his kin over aggressive attacks.

interactions.buttonText: Return to The Lonely Mountain Interior
interactions.resultText: You make your way back to the lonely mountain interior.

thorins_charge.title: The King's Last Stand
thorins_charge.content:
You find yourself at the heart of the battle as Thorin Oakenshield leads his most desperate charge toward Ravenhill. The dwarf-king's golden armor blazes in the afternoon sun, and Orcrist, the Goblin-cleaver, sings its deadly song as he cuts through enemy ranks. 'To me! To me!' Thorin roars. 'The battle will be won on Ravenhill!' His voice carries above the clash of steel and the screams of the dying, rallying dwarves, men, and elves alike to this final push.

Balin fights beside his king with grim determination, his ancient beard stained with goblin blood. The map of the Lonely Mountain lies partially unfurled in your pack - its moon-letters glowing faintly even in daylight, as if responding to the proximity of the kingdom it depicts. You realize this could be Thorin's moment of ultimate triumph or his final hour. The weight of the Arkenstone in your pack seems heavier than ever as you witness the king's courage.

interactions.buttonText: Study the glowing moon-letters on the map
interactions.resultText: The moon-letters on Thorin's map pulse with ethereal light, responding to the closeness of the Lonely Mountain. The secret entrance is clearly marked, and you can make out ancient Dwarvish runes that speak of the king's return.

Thorin's eyes blaze with the fire of his ancestors as he sees you beside him. 'Master Baggins! You have proven yourself a true friend to the line of Durin! Stand with me now as we reclaim our birthright!'

Though you don't wield Orcrist yourself, the sight of the legendary blade in Thorin's hands fills you with determination. You draw your own weapon and fight with renewed vigor, inspired by the sword's ancient power.

You pull the Arkenstone from your pack and hold it high. Its light blazes across the battlefield. 'The Heart of the Mountain!' Thorin gasps. 'You... you had it all along!' His expression transforms from rage to something approaching peace.

interactions.buttonText: Ask Thorin about his quest's true meaning
interactions.resultText: For a moment, Thorin's battle-fury fades and you see the weight of kingship in his eyes. 'It was never about the gold, Master Burglar. It was about home. About proving that the line of Durin would never be broken.'
You stay close to Thorin as he pushes forward, cutting through goblin ranks. The battle grows fiercer with every step toward the heart of Ravenhill, where Azog the Defiler awaits.

interactions.buttonText: Encourage Thorin to show mercy to defeated foes
interactions.resultText: You place a restraining hand on Thorin's arm as he stands over a wounded goblin. 'Your majesty, you are a king, not just a warrior. Show them what Durin's line truly represents.' Thorin pauses, conflict warring in his eyes.

interactions.buttonText: Return to The Lonely Mountain Interior
interactions.resultText: You make your way back to the lonely mountain interior.

rescue_wounded.title: Angel of Mercy
rescue_wounded.content:
While invisible with the Ring, you move among the wounded scattered across the battlefield like an angel of mercy. The magical band makes you unseen but not unfelt - you can still tend to the injured and dying without fear of goblin arrows. Bodies lie strewn across the rocky ground: dwarves, men, elves, and goblins alike, all equal in their suffering. You spot Balin leaning heavily against a boulder, his left arm hanging uselessly at his side, blood seeping through his chainmail.

Nearby, the strange prison cells from the Woodland Realm have been abandoned in the chaos - perhaps dragged here as makeshift cover or dropped by fleeing elves. Your pack contains precious supplies: Elrond's lembas bread that could restore strength to the wounded, and your water skin filled with clean mountain water. Ancient coins glitter among the debris, dropped by fleeing soldiers, but your attention focuses on the wounded who need immediate help.

interactions.buttonText: Share Elrond's lembas with the wounded
interactions.resultText: You break pieces of the miraculous lembas bread and place them in the mouths of wounded soldiers. Even small crumbs restore color to pale faces and strength to trembling limbs. Your mercy does not go unnoticed by those you save.

These ornate elven cells have been abandoned in the chaos of battle. Their locks are intricate works of art, but you notice they could potentially be used as shelter or barricades for the wounded. Some still bear traces of their former occupants.

You remove the Ring to appear beside the injured dwarf. Balin's eyes widen in surprise and relief. 'Master Bilbo! I feared you had fallen. This old dwarf has seen his last charge, I think, but knowing you live gives me hope.'
You tip your water skin to the lips of wounded fighters, dwarf and man alike. Clean mountain water proves as precious as gold in this moment, bringing relief to parched throats and cleansing wounds.
You collect the ancient coins scattered across the battlefield - not from greed, but thinking they might be needed to purchase medical supplies or food for survivors once this terrible day ends.

interactions.buttonText: Give mithril shirt to a dying warrior
interactions.resultText: You remove your precious mithril shirt and carefully place it over a critically wounded elf warrior. The magical armor immediately begins to stabilize his wounds. Balin nods approvingly at your selfless act.

interactions.buttonText: Continue rescue efforts deeper in the battlefield
interactions.resultText: You slip the Ring back on and move deeper into the chaos, seeking more wounded who need your help. Your invisible mercy will be remembered by those you save, even if they never see their savior.

interactions.buttonText: Reveal yourself and the Ring's power
interactions.resultText: You decide that secrecy is less important than inspiring hope. You remove the Ring dramatically, appearing before the wounded soldiers like a spirit of mercy made manifest. Gasps of wonder echo across the battlefield.

thorins_fall.title: The Dying King
thorins_fall.content:
The clash of kings echoes across Ravenhill as Thorin Oakenshield faces Azog the Defiler in single combat. You arrive just as both warriors land mortal blows - Orcrist pierces the pale orc's heart even as Azog's blade finds its mark between the plates of Thorin's golden armor. The dwarf-king staggers backward and collapses against a rocky outcrop, his breath coming in ragged gasps. Crimson spreads across his magnificent armor like spilled wine.

Balin reaches Thorin's side moments after you do, tears streaming down the old dwarf's weathered cheeks. 'My king... my dear friend...' he whispers. Thorin's eyes find yours through the haze of pain, and for the first time since you met him in Bag End, they hold no anger, no suspicion, only a profound weariness and something that might be peace. Orcrist lies beside him, its blade still gleaming despite the blood, while the sounds of battle fade as word spreads that the King Under the Mountain has fallen.

interactions.resultText: Thorin's hand reaches out weakly toward you. 'Master Baggins... forgive me. I was wrong to doubt you. You have more courage in your little finger than many warriors have in their whole body. Farewell, my friend.'

interactions.buttonText: Look upon Orcrist one last time
interactions.resultText: The Goblin-cleaver lies beside its fallen master, its blade still magnificent despite the carnage. This ancient sword has served the line of Durin faithfully, and now it rests with the last King Under the Mountain. Its work, like Thorin's, is done.

interactions.buttonText: Place the Arkenstone in Thorin's hands
interactions.resultText: You place the Heart of the Mountain in Thorin's failing hands. Even in death's shadow, the great gem blazes with inner fire. 'It... it is beautiful,' Thorin whispers. 'More beautiful than I remembered. Thank you for bringing it home.'

Thorin's eyes grow distant. 'I would... I would have been a better king to my people. Gold fever blinded me to what truly mattered. Promise me, Bilbo... remember me not as I was in madness, but as I could have been.'

interactions.buttonText: Try to heal Thorin with lembas bread
interactions.resultText: You offer pieces of the healing lembas, but Thorin weakly pushes your hand away. 'No, my friend. Some wounds cannot be healed by any bread of the Elves. Save it for those who can still fight... still live.'

interactions.buttonText: Stay with Thorin until the end
interactions.resultText: You kneel beside the dying king, holding vigil as his breathing grows shallower. These may be his final moments, and you will not let him face them alone.

You stand and raise your voice so all can hear. 'Let it be known that Thorin Oakenshield, son of Thrain, son of Thror, died as he lived - with honor! He was King Under the Mountain, and he has reclaimed his birthright!'

interactions.buttonText: Return to The Lonely Mountain Interior
interactions.resultText: You make your way back to the lonely mountain interior.

eagles_victory.title: Victory from Above
eagles_victory.content:
The great eagles' intervention turns the tide of battle decisively in favor of the Free Peoples. From your elevated perch on the Lord of the Eagles' back, you watch as goblin formations break and scatter under the aerial assault. Wargs flee howling back toward the mountains, their riders clinging desperately to their backs. The sight of the eagles, with their piercing cries and massive wingspans, strikes terror into the hearts of Sauron's servants who had never faced such majestic opponents.

The Lord of the Eagles circles triumphantly above the battlefield, his powerful voice carrying across the valley: 'The Eagles are coming! The Eagles are coming!' Below, dwarves, men, and elves cheer and raise their weapons in salute. Victory banners begin to appear as organized goblin resistance collapses. You feel the wind of triumph beneath the eagle's wings, and somewhere in your pack, you discover a magnificent jewel that must have been dropped by a fleeing goblin chieftain - a king's jewel worthy of the hoard of Erebor.

interactions.buttonText: Celebrate with the Lord of the Eagles
interactions.resultText: The great eagle's fierce cry of triumph nearly deafens you. 'Well fought, little warrior! You have seen eagles at war, and you have proven yourself worthy to fly with us. The victory song will speak of this day!'

The battlefield below has transformed from a scene of desperate struggle to one of clear victory. Goblin banners lie trampled in the mud, while the standards of dwarves, men, and elves fly proudly. The tide has truly turned.

interactions.buttonText: Cherish the eagle feather as a trophy
interactions.resultText: You carefully examine the eagle feather you've carried throughout your journey. After witnessing the eagles' magnificent victory, it seems to glow with new significance - a token of this historic triumph.
You spot a magnificent jewel glinting in the rocks - dropped by some fleeing goblin chieftain. The precious stone is carved with ancient runes and seems valuable enough to grace a king's crown.

interactions.buttonText: Request a victory flight over the mountain
interactions.resultText: You ask the Lord of the Eagles for one final flight - a victory lap over the Lonely Mountain itself. The great eagle spreads his wings wide and soars toward Erebor, carrying you above your reclaimed destination.

interactions.buttonText: Ask to return to the battlefield
interactions.resultText: You tap the eagle's neck and point downward. 'My friends will be looking for me down there,' you explain. The Lord of the Eagles nods understanding and begins a graceful descent toward solid ground.

interactions.buttonText: Return to The Lonely Mountain Interior
interactions.resultText: You make your way back to the lonely mountain interior.

final_words.title: Farewell to a King
final_words.content:
You kneel beside Thorin as his breathing grows shallow, the sounds of battle fading to a distant murmur. His eyes, once blazing with the fire of his ancestors, now hold a different light—one of peace and recognition. The weight of his mortality hangs heavy in the air, and you feel the profound shift of an era ending. Balin stands nearby, tears streaming down his weathered face as he watches his king and friend prepare for his final journey.

Thorin's hand finds yours with surprising strength, and his voice, though weak, carries the authority of kings. The battlefield around you seems to hold its breath, as if the very stones of Erebor pause to witness this moment. You realize that all the gold in the mountain pales beside the treasure of these final words, spoken between a burglar and a king who found understanding in their last moments together.

interactions.resultText: You lean close as Thorin whispers his final thoughts, his voice carrying both regret and gratitude. He speaks of the dragon-sickness that clouded his judgment and thanks you for your loyalty despite his harsh words.
Thorin shakes his head weakly, a sad smile crossing his face. 'There is nothing to forgive, Master Baggins. It is I who must ask your forgiveness. You are a true friend.'
You place the contract in Thorin's hands, but he pushes it back to you. 'Keep it, my friend. You have earned far more than any contract could promise.'
The great sword Orcrist lies beside Thorin, its blade still gleaming despite the battle. Even in death, it seems to guard its master, a testament to the nobility of its bearer.
You speak from your heart about the journey you shared, the friendship that grew despite differences. Thorin's eyes shine with gratitude as he passes peacefully.
You place a gentle hand on Balin's shoulder. The old dwarf looks up with tear-filled eyes and nods gratefully. 'He was the best of us, Master Bilbo. The very best.'
The sounds of war are fading as you look across the field. Victory has come, but at such a cost. The price of gold and glory lies heavy on your heart.

interactions.buttonText: Return to The Lonely Mountain Interior
interactions.resultText: You make your way back to the lonely mountain interior.

hidden_heroics.title: Unseen Valor
hidden_heroics.content:
The battlefield grows quiet around you, save for the moans of the wounded and the distant sound of others tending to the fallen. Your deeds during the battle—the lives saved, the courage shown in the face of overwhelming odds—remain largely unnoticed by the great leaders planning their victory celebrations. But Balin has watched, and his weathered eyes hold a respect that speaks louder than any horn of triumph.

You stand among the aftermath, your clothes torn and stained, yet feeling strangely at peace. The Ring rests heavy in your pocket, a reminder of the power you wielded not for conquest, but for protection. The true treasure of this day lies not in gold reclaimed, but in the lives preserved and the quiet heroism that needs no songs or stories to validate its worth.

interactions.buttonText: Speak with Balin about the battle
interactions.resultText: Balin nods knowingly as you approach. 'I saw what you did out there, Master Bilbo. Others may not have noticed, but a dwarf remembers his debts. You saved more lives today than any sword.'
You feel the Ring's weight in your pocket, remembering how its power helped you move unseen to aid the wounded. Unlike others who might use such power for domination, you found strength in service.
The field tells many stories—of valor and loss, of victory's price. You see where you pulled wounded soldiers to safety, places where your small acts of mercy made all the difference.

interactions.buttonText: Pick up a fallen elven brooch
interactions.resultText: You carefully lift a beautiful brooch from near a fallen elf warrior, perhaps to return to his kin. It serves as a reminder that courage comes in all forms and from all peoples.

interactions.buttonText: Ask Balin about what happens now
interactions.resultText: Balin strokes his beard thoughtfully. 'The mountain is ours again, but at such cost. Perhaps it's time for quieter heroism, Master Bilbo. The kind you've shown us today.'

interactions.buttonText: Tell Balin about your rescue efforts
interactions.resultText: You quietly describe how you moved through the battle, using the Ring to help the wounded and protect the vulnerable. Balin listens with growing admiration and nods with deep respect.

bilbos_departure.title: The Road Home
bilbos_departure.content:
The great battle is over, and Erebor stands reclaimed, but the victory feels hollow in the wake of so much loss. You stand at a crossroads, both literal and metaphorical, as you consider your future. The dwarves are busy with their kingdom's restoration, and while they would welcome your permanent residence, your heart pulls toward the green hills of home. The question remains: how will you make this journey? The road is long and potentially dangerous for a lone hobbit, yet something deep within you yearns for solitude to process all you've experienced.

Balin approaches with a knowing look, sensing your inner conflict. He carries a travel pack prepared by the grateful dwarves, filled with provisions for your journey. The weight of decision hangs heavy—will you travel in the safety of company, or trust in your newfound courage to walk the lonely road home? Each choice promises its own adventures and revelations.

interactions.resultText: You decide that this journey requires solitude and reflection. Balin nods with understanding, respecting your choice to walk the path of self-discovery. The road beckons with quiet promise.
You express your preference for company on the long road home. Balin smiles warmly, understanding that some journeys are better shared, and promises to arrange suitable companions.
Balin listens thoughtfully to your concerns about the journey ahead. His wise words help clarify your thoughts about what path would serve you best in returning home.
You inspect the carefully prepared pack, finding it stocked with provisions, a warm cloak, and small tokens of friendship from the dwarves. It's equipped for either solo travel or shared journey.

interactions.buttonText: Accept silver spoons as parting gift
interactions.resultText: Balin presses the beautiful silver spoons into your hands, a parting gift from the recovered treasure. 'A small token of our gratitude, Master Bilbo. May they remind you of friends.'
The mountain stands proud against the sky, its halls once again filled with dwarvish voices. You feel a mixture of pride and melancholy knowing your part in this restoration.
Balin's eyes shine with hope as he describes plans for rebuilding. 'We'll make it a kingdom worthy of Thorin's memory, Master Bilbo. Your burglar skills helped make it possible.'

journey_home.title: The Long Road Back
journey_home.content:
Months have passed since you left the Lonely Mountain, and the road has been long but enlightening. Each mile has brought new understanding of the hobbit you were and the person you've become. The familiar green door of Bag End stands before you now, somehow both exactly as you left it and utterly transformed by your new perspective. Your garden shows signs of neglect, and curious neighbors peer from their windows, whispering about the hobbit who vanished for over a year.

You stand on your own doorstep, hand on the brass knocker, feeling the weight of two worlds upon your shoulders. Inside await comfort, respectability, and the quiet life you once treasured. Yet you carry within you memories of dragons and eagles, of friendship forged in darkness and courage discovered in the most unlikely circumstances. The Ring sits heavy in your pocket—a secret that bridges your two lives, ordinary and extraordinary.

interactions.buttonText: Study your home with new eyes
interactions.resultText: Bag End looks smaller somehow, yet more precious. You notice details that escaped you before—the craftsmanship of the door, the careful way the garden was planned. Home has new meaning now.
You clean the brass buttons on your waistcoat, remembering how they once seemed the height of respectability. Now they're merely buttons, though they still shine with care and pride.
You find your finest pipe-weed exactly where you left it. The familiar ritual of preparing a pipe brings comfort, a bridge between your old life and new wisdom.
You move to your comfortable study, ready to begin the next chapter of your life. The adventures are over, but the stories and wisdom they brought will last forever.
You decide to fully embrace your return to peaceful domesticity, knowing that adventure lives in your heart even in the quietest moments. True contentment comes from within.

interactions.buttonText: Look at treasures from your journey
interactions.resultText: You carefully examine the items you brought back—each one carrying memories of friendship, danger, and discovery. They transform your simple hobbit hole into a gallery of wonders.
In the privacy of your home, you examine the Ring closely. Its power seems quieter here, more manageable, though you sense its significance will echo through your life.

game_end.title: There and Back Again
game_end.content:
You settle into your favorite armchair by the fire, a cup of tea steaming gently beside you and your pipe sending comfortable smoke rings toward the ceiling. The red leather-bound book lies open in your lap, its blank pages waiting to be filled with the most extraordinary tale any hobbit has ever lived to tell. Outside, the Shire continues its peaceful rhythm, unchanged by your great adventure, yet you are forever transformed.

The Ring rests safely in your pocket, its weight familiar now but its significance a secret you'll carry alone. Your neighbors whisper about your strange year-long absence and your new peculiar habits—the way you sometimes stare at the horizon, the odd smile that crosses your face during quiet moments, the expensive items that now grace your hobbit hole. Let them whisper. You have stories that would make their comfortable little lives seem small indeed.

But perhaps that's the greatest treasure of all—knowing that adventure and wonder exist beyond the garden gate, that courage can be found in the most unlikely places, and that home is made sweeter by having been away from it. You dip your pen in ink and begin to write: 'In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: it was a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort.'

The story of Bilbo Baggins, burglar and hero, has ended. But the legend of what one small person can accomplish when they step outside their door is just beginning to be told.

bag_end.name: Bag End
bag_end.description: Your comfortable hobbit-hole with its round green door, well-stocked pantries, and cozy rooms. Everything a hobbit could want for a peaceful life.

exits.description: The round green door leading out to the lane

hobbiton.name: Hobbiton
hobbiton.description: A peaceful village of hobbit-holes built into grassy hillsides. Well-kept gardens bloom everywhere, and smoke curls from many chimneys.

exits.description: The lane leading to your hobbit-hole
The road leading south toward Bywater

bywater.name: Bywater
bywater.description: A small village with the Green Dragon Inn at its heart. This is where your adventure truly began when you met the dwarves.

exits.description: The road leading into the wild lands

lone_lands.name: The Lone-lands
lone_lands.description: Empty, desolate country with poor roads and no settlements. The wind whistles through barren hills and sparse, twisted trees.

exits.description: A path leading to a clearing with strange lights
The path toward the hidden valley

troll_camp.name: Troll Camp
troll_camp.description: A clearing where three massive stone trolls sit frozen around a cold fire. They were caught by the dawn and turned to stone forever.

exits.description: A dark cave behind the trolls

troll_cave.name: Troll Cave
troll_cave.description: A musty cave filled with the trolls' hoard. Pots of gold gleam in the darkness, and ancient weapons hang on the walls.

rivendell_approach.name: Approach to Rivendell
rivendell_approach.description: The path winds through pine forests toward a hidden valley. The air grows sweeter and you can hear distant singing.

rivendell.name: Rivendell
rivendell.description: The Last Homely House, a beautiful valley refuge with elegant buildings and terraced gardens. Elves sing softly as they walk the paths.

exits.description: Up the path from the valley
The path leading to the mountain passes

misty_mountains_pass.name: Misty Mountains Pass
misty_mountains_pass.description: Treacherous mountain paths wind between towering peaks. The weather is harsh and stone-giants battle in the heights above.

exits.description: A cave tunnel leading into the mountain

goblin_town_entrance.name: Goblin-town Entrance
goblin_town_entrance.description: The mouth of a vast tunnel system. Crude goblin architecture and the sound of drums echo from the depths.

goblin_town.name: Goblin-town
goblin_town.description: A vast underground city of crude tunnels and caverns. Goblins swarm everywhere, and the Great Goblin's throne dominates the main hall.

exits.description: A narrow passage leading to the depths

gollums_cave.name: Gollum's Cave
gollums_cave.description: A dark underground lake in the very roots of the mountain. A small island sits in the middle, and the water is black as night.

exits.description: Back up to the goblin tunnels
A hidden passage leading out of the mountain

mountain_exit.name: Mountain Exit
mountain_exit.description: A small cave opening on the eastern side of the Misty Mountains. Fresh air and sunlight stream in from outside.

carrock.name: The Carrock
carrock.description: A great rock formation jutting from the mountainside. Eagles soar overhead, and you can see vast lands stretching eastward.

exits.description: A path leading up to the eagles' nests

eagles_eyrie.name: Eagles' Eyrie
eagles_eyrie.description: The high mountain home of the great eagles. Massive nests perch on rocky ledges, and the view of Middle-earth is breathtaking.

anduin_valley.name: Anduin Valley
anduin_valley.description: A wide valley with the great river Anduin flowing through it. Green meadows and oak woods stretch toward distant hills.

beorns_lands.name: Beorn's Lands
beorns_lands.description: Wide pastures where horses and cattle graze peacefully. Rows of beehives line the approach to a massive wooden hall.

beorns_hall.name: Beorn's Hall
beorns_hall.description: A great wooden hall with a massive fireplace and long tables. Animal servants bustle about, and the smell of honey and bread fills the air.

mirkwood_entrance.name: Edge of Mirkwood
mirkwood_entrance.description: The border of a vast, dark forest. The trees are so thick that little sunlight penetrates, and the path disappears into gloom.

mirkwood_path.name: Mirkwood Path
mirkwood_path.description: A narrow path through the enchanted forest. Strange whispers echo from the dark trees, and the way seems to twist and turn on its own.

exits.description: A side path leading to a clearing

spider_clearing.name: Spider Clearing
spider_clearing.description: A circular clearing where giant spiders have spun their webs between the trees. Cocoons hang ominously from the branches.

woodland_realm_entrance.name: Woodland Realm Gates
woodland_realm_entrance.description: Massive doors carved into living trees mark the entrance to the Elvenking's halls. Elf-guards watch from hidden positions.

woodland_realm.name: Woodland Realm
woodland_realm.description: The underground palace of the Elvenking, carved from living rock and tree roots. Pillars of stone support vast halls lit by crystal lamps.

forest_river.name: Forest River
forest_river.description: An underground river that flows from the Elvenking's halls toward Long Lake. Empty barrels bob in the dark water.

lake_town_docks.name: Lake-town Docks
lake_town_docks.description: Wooden piers and jetties where boats moor at Lake-town. The smell of fish and tar mingles with smoke from the town chimneys.

lake_town.name: Lake-town
lake_town.description: A town built entirely on stilts over the Long Lake. Wooden bridges connect buildings that creak and sway in the wind.

exits.description: Across the lake toward the mountain

dale_ruins.name: Dale Ruins
dale_ruins.description: The ruined city of Dale, destroyed by Smaug years ago. Broken walls and empty buildings stand as monuments to the dragon's wrath.

lonely_mountain_approach.name: Lonely Mountain Approach
lonely_mountain_approach.description: The desolate slopes of Erebor, the Lonely Mountain. No grass grows here, and the very air seems heavy with the presence of the dragon.

exits.description: Back to the ruins of Dale
To the main gates of Erebor

lonely_mountain.name: The Lonely Mountain Interior
lonely_mountain.description: Inside Erebor through the secret door. Ancient dwarven craftsmanship is visible everywhere, though dust and debris litter the halls.

smaugs_lair.name: Smaug's Lair
smaugs_lair.description: The vast treasure chamber where Smaug the dragon sleeps atop a hoard of gold and jewels. The air shimmers with heat and menace.

exits.description: Back to the halls of Erebor

erebor_halls.name: Great Halls of Erebor
erebor_halls.description: The main halls of the dwarven kingdom, carved from living rock with pillars that reach up into darkness. Dust motes dance in shafts of light.

throne_of_erebor.name: Throne of Erebor
throne_of_erebor.description: The great throne room of the Kings under the Mountain. A magnificent stone throne sits before vast windows looking out over the desolation.

battle_field.name: Battle Field
battle_field.description: The plain before Erebor where the Battle of Five Armies was fought. The ground is scarred and weapons still litter the field.

ravens_hill.name: Ravenhill
ravens_hill.description: A hill where the ravens of Erebor once nested. Ancient signal towers stand on the heights, and you can see for miles around.

secret_door.name: Secret Door of Erebor
secret_door.description: A hidden door in the mountainside, invisible unless you know where to look. Ancient dwarven runes mark its frame.

interactions.resultText: You study the rock face and notice subtle differences in the stone. There's definitely something here.

interactions.buttonText: Use the key on the door
interactions.resultText: The key fits perfectly! The door swings open silently, revealing the passage into Erebor.

troll_stone_door.name: Troll Cave Door
troll_stone_door.description: A heavy stone door blocking the entrance to the troll cave. It looks like it hasn't been moved in years.

interactions.resultText: You push against the stone with all your might. Gradually, it begins to move with a grinding sound.

prison_cells.name: Elvenking's Prison Cells
prison_cells.description: Sturdy cells carved from living wood, bound with elven magic. The dwarves are locked inside, looking dejected.

interactions.resultText: Using your ring, you sneak past the guards and steal their keys without being seen.

riddle_stones.name: Gollum's Riddle Stones
riddle_stones.description: Ancient stones arranged in a circle around Gollum's island. They seem to pulse with an eerie light when riddles are spoken.

interactions.resultText: You match wits with Gollum in a deadly game of riddles. Your final question stumps him: 'What have I got in my pocket?'

moon_letters_map.name: Map with Moon Letters
moon_letters_map.description: Thorin's map, but now you can see the hidden moon-letters that reveal the secret of the door.

interactions.resultText: The secret writing glows in the moonlight: 'Stand by the grey stone when the thrush knocks, and the setting sun will shine upon the keyhole.'

bilbo_baggins.name: Bilbo Baggins
bilbo_baggins.description: A small hobbit with furry feet and a love of comfort. You've grown braver throughout this adventure, though you still long for home.

dialogue.response: What a long way I've come from Bag End. I never thought I'd see dragons and goblins, let alone survive them!

gandalf.name: Gandalf the Grey
gandalf.description: A tall wizard in a grey cloak and pointed hat. His eyes twinkle with wisdom and mischief, and his staff gleams with subtle power.

dialogue.response: Adventures are not all pony rides in May sunshine, my dear Bilbo. But they are necessary for growth.
A magic ring, you say? How interesting. Keep it safe, Bilbo. It may be more important than you know.
I knew there was more to you than meets the eye, Bilbo Baggins. You have the heart of a true adventurer.

thorin_oakenshield.name: Thorin Oakenshield
thorin_oakenshield.description: The proud leader of the dwarves, heir to the throne of Erebor. He has a magnificent bearing but can be stern and suspicious.

dialogue.response: Erebor was the greatest of the dwarf-kingdoms. We shall reclaim what is ours by right, no matter the cost.
I admit I doubted you at first, Master Baggins. But you have proven yourself a true member of this company.
The Arkenstone is the Heart of the Mountain, the treasure above all others. It belongs to the line of Durin.

gollum.name: Gollum
gollum.description: A wretched creature with pale, luminous eyes and long thin hands. He speaks in hisses and croaks, obsessed with his 'precious' ring.

dialogue.response: Yessss, precious wants to play riddles? We knows good riddles, we does. If precious wins, we shows the way out, yesss.
Where is it? Where is our precious? Thief! Baggins! We hates it forever!
What has roots as nobody sees, is taller than trees, up, up it goes, and yet never grows?

smaug.name: Smaug the Mighty
smaug.description: A vast dragon with scales like armor and eyes like furnaces. His voice rumbles like distant thunder, and fire burns in his throat.

dialogue.response: My armor is like tenfold shields, my teeth are swords! I am fire, I am death! What can you do against such power?
Barrel-rider! Lucky number! I smell you, I hear your breath. Where are you? Come along, help yourself again, there is plenty and to spare!

elrond.name: Elrond
elrond.description: Master of Rivendell, an elf-lord with the wisdom of ages. His face is ageless and kind, and ancient knowledge gleams in his eyes.

dialogue.response: This map bears moon-letters, written in silver under the light of the moon. They reveal a secret that only appears at the right time.
These are blades forged in Gondolin, of old. Glamdring and Orcrist they were called - Foe-hammer and Goblin-cleaver.
The wise speak only of what they know. Yet I sense great things ahead for you, Ring-bearer.

beorn.name: Beorn
beorn.description: A large, strong man who can take the shape of a great bear. He lives alone with his animal friends and has little love for goblins.

dialogue.response: Goblins! I hate them. They are the enemies of all free folk. If you have killed some, then you are friends to me.
Do not stray from the path in Mirkwood, or you will never find it again. The wood is full of strange creatures now.

bard.name: Bard the Bowman
bard.description: A skilled archer and descendant of the lords of Dale. He has a grim but noble bearing, and his eyes hold both sorrow and determination.

dialogue.response: Smaug the Terrible has slept too long. His death would free this land from shadow, but who could accomplish such a deed?
Dale was my ancestors' city, destroyed by dragon-fire. If Smaug were to fall, Dale could live again.
The black arrow of my forefathers - it has never missed its mark. Perhaps today it will find the dragon's heart.

thranduil.name: Thranduil the Elvenking
thranduil.description: King of the woodland elves, proud and somewhat cold. He wears a crown of autumn leaves and his eyes hold the wisdom of long ages.

dialogue.response: The dwarves are prisoners here until they reveal their purpose in my realm. I do not trust their intentions.
There are gems in the mountain that by right belong to my people. The dwarves would do well to remember this.

balin.name: Balin
balin.description: An elderly dwarf with a white beard, one of the wisest and kindest of Thorin's company. His eyes twinkle with good humor and experience.

dialogue.response: Ah, you should have seen Erebor in its glory days, Master Baggins. The halls rang with song and the forges never grew cold.
You've done well, lad. Better than any of us expected when Gandalf first brought you along.

master_of_laketown.name: Master of Lake-town
master_of_laketown.description: The greedy, cowardly elected leader of Lake-town. He thinks only of profit and comfort, with little care for his people's wellbeing.

dialogue.response: Trade, yes! That's what Lake-town needs. Gold flowing through our markets - it's the only thing that matters.
Dragon? Nonsense! Just old wives' tales to frighten children. There's been no dragon for years!

lord_of_eagles.name: Lord of the Eagles
lord_of_eagles.description: The mighty king of the great eagles, with feathers of gold and brown. His voice carries the authority of the high mountains and open sky.

dialogue.response: We are the enemies of the goblins and their wolves. Any foe of theirs may count on our aid, when the need is great.
The eagles are coming! We will not let evil triumph on this day!

the_one_ring.name: The One Ring
the_one_ring.description: A simple gold ring that grants invisibility to its wearer. It feels strangely warm and seems to have a will of its own.
the_one_ring.useText: You slip the ring onto your finger and feel yourself fading from sight.

sting.name: Sting
sting.description: A small elven sword that glows blue when goblins or orcs are near. It's perfectly sized for a hobbit and surprisingly sharp.
sting.useText: You draw Sting. Its elven blade gleams with a cold light.

thorins_map.name: Thorin's Map
thorins_map.description: An ancient map of the Lonely Mountain drawn by Thror. Strange markings suggest there are secrets yet to be revealed.
thorins_map.useText: You study the map carefully, tracing the paths to the mountain.

thorins_key.name: Thorin's Key
thorins_key.description: A silver key with intricate dwarven runes. It's said to open the secret door into the Lonely Mountain.
thorins_key.useText: The key gleams with silver light, perfectly crafted by ancient dwarven smiths.

orcrist.name: Orcrist
orcrist.description: The Goblin-cleaver, an ancient elven sword with a jeweled hilt. It was forged in Gondolin and is the mate to Glamdring.
orcrist.useText: The ancient blade hums with power as you lift it.

glamdring.name: Glamdring
glamdring.description: Gandalf's elven sword, also called Foe-hammer. Like Orcrist, it was forged in Gondolin and glows with inner light.
glamdring.useText: Foe-hammer gleams with the light of ancient Gondolin.

arkenstone.name: The Arkenstone
arkenstone.description: The Heart of the Mountain, a great white jewel that captures and reflects light like a star. It was the greatest treasure of Erebor.
arkenstone.useText: The Arkenstone blazes with inner fire, beautiful beyond description.

mithril_shirt.name: Mithril Shirt
mithril_shirt.description: A shirt of mail made from mithril, light as silk but harder than dragon-scales. It's worth more than the entire Shire.
mithril_shirt.useText: The mithril shirt feels impossibly light yet completely protective.

troll_gold.name: Troll Treasure
troll_gold.description: Pots of gold coins and various valuables hoarded by the three trolls. Heavy but valuable.
troll_gold.useText: The gold coins clink together with a satisfying sound.

beorns_honey.name: Beorn's Honey Cakes
beorns_honey.description: Special travel food provided by Beorn. These honey cakes remain fresh and nourishing throughout the longest journeys.
beorns_honey.useText: The honey cakes are deliciously sweet and surprisingly filling.

elronds_lembas.name: Elven Lembas
elronds_lembas.description: Special waybread from Rivendell wrapped in leaves. A single cake can sustain a grown man for a day of hard travel.
elronds_lembas.useText: The lembas bread is light but incredibly nourishing.

gandalfs_staff.name: Gandalf's Staff
gandalfs_staff.description: A tall wooden staff topped with a crystal that can produce light and channel magical power. It belongs to Gandalf the Grey.
gandalfs_staff.useText: The crystal atop the staff glows with soft white light.

burglar_contract.name: Burglar Contract
burglar_contract.description: The written agreement outlining your terms of employment as a burglar, including rather specific funeral arrangements.
burglar_contract.useText: You read through the contract again, noting the clause about funeral expenses.

rope.name: Elven Rope
rope.description: Strong rope given to you by the elves. It seems to have a mind of its own and comes untied when needed.
rope.useText: The rope feels alive in your hands, ready to serve when needed.

pipe_weed.name: Pipe-weed
pipe_weed.description: Fine pipe-weed from the Shire. A comfort from home that helps calm your nerves in dangerous situations.
pipe_weed.useText: You pack your pipe and take a few calming puffs.

brass_buttons.name: Brass Buttons
brass_buttons.description: Shiny brass buttons from your waistcoat. They've survived the entire adventure remarkably well.
brass_buttons.useText: The brass buttons gleam despite all your adventures.

pocket_handkerchief.name: Pocket Handkerchief
pocket_handkerchief.description: A clean handkerchief from home. A small comfort that reminds you of the civilized world of the Shire.
pocket_handkerchief.useText: You dab at your face with the handkerchief - still clean after all this time.

wooden_cup.name: Wooden Cup
wooden_cup.description: A simple wooden drinking cup. Practical and unbreakable, unlike fancy porcelain.
wooden_cup.useText: The wooden cup has served you well throughout the journey.

flint_and_steel.name: Flint and Steel
flint_and_steel.description: Essential fire-starting equipment. Valuable beyond measure when you're cold and wet in the wilderness.
flint_and_steel.useText: You strike the flint against steel, producing bright sparks.

water_skin.name: Water Skin
water_skin.description: A leather water container. Staying hydrated is important when you're walking across Middle-earth.
water_skin.useText: You take a refreshing drink from the water skin.

trail_biscuits.name: Trail Biscuits
trail_biscuits.description: Hard-baked travel biscuits that last for weeks. Not very tasty, but they keep you fed.
trail_biscuits.useText: The biscuits are hard but surprisingly satisfying.

silver_spoons.name: Silver Spoons
silver_spoons.description: Fine silver spoons from Bag End. You're not sure why you brought them, but they remind you of home.
silver_spoons.useText: The silver spoons gleam with memories of comfortable meals at home.

seed_cake.name: Seed Cake
seed_cake.description: A small cake packed with seeds and nuts. Another taste of home that you've been saving.
seed_cake.useText: The seed cake is dense with flavor and memories of your pantry.

dwarf_bread.name: Dwarf Bread
dwarf_bread.description: Dense, nutritious bread made by the dwarves. It's incredibly filling and lasts for months without spoiling.
dwarf_bread.useText: The dwarf bread is heavy but provides lasting sustenance.

eagle_feather.name: Eagle Feather
eagle_feather.description: A golden-brown feather from one of the great eagles. A token of their friendship and aid.
eagle_feather.useText: The eagle feather shimmers with the memory of soaring through the sky.

spider_silk.name: Spider Silk
spider_silk.description: Strong silk thread from the giant spiders of Mirkwood. Disturbing but potentially useful.
spider_silk.useText: The spider silk is stronger than any rope, though it makes you shudder to touch it.

elf_cloak.name: Elven Cloak
elf_cloak.description: A grey cloak from Lothlórien that helps the wearer blend into shadows and forest.
elf_cloak.useText: The elven cloak seems to shift color to match your surroundings.

dragon_scale.name: Dragon Scale
dragon_scale.description: A single scale that fell from Smaug's hide. It's harder than steel and warm to the touch.
dragon_scale.useText: The dragon scale radiates heat and seems almost alive.

dwarf_ring.name: Dwarven Ring
dwarf_ring.description: A ring of dwarf-make with intricate carvings. It bears the mark of Erebor's master smiths.
dwarf_ring.useText: The dwarven ring is masterfully crafted with ancient runes around the band.

kings_jewel.name: King's Jewel
kings_jewel.description: A precious gem from the hoard of Erebor. It catches the light and throws rainbows on the walls.
kings_jewel.useText: The jewel sparkles with all the colors of the rainbow.

ancient_coins.name: Ancient Coins
ancient_coins.description: Old coins from various kingdoms, some dating back centuries. Each one tells a story of forgotten realms.
ancient_coins.useText: The ancient coins bear the marks of long-dead kings and forgotten empires.

elven_brooch.name: Elven Brooch
elven_brooch.description: A delicate silver brooch in the shape of a leaf. It was crafted by elven smiths in ages past.
elven_brooch.useText: The elven brooch gleams with the silver light of the stars.

travel_pack.name: Travel Pack
travel_pack.description: A sturdy pack for carrying supplies. It's seen you through the entire journey and shows every mile.
travel_pack.useText: The travel pack is worn but still strong, like yourself after this adventure.
